name: 戰爭創傷文學研究
comment: 教室位於雲和街大樓2樓（地址：雲和街1號），外系及外校學生需申請門禁權限。
goals: To provide a critical overview of (mainly western) literatures of war trauma, with an emphasis on literature but with also some consideration given to philosophical contributions to this topic
To provide students with a range of opportunities to practice close reading and historical and other forms of analysis of a diverse sample of challenging literature
To provide students with the opportunity to present their own original analyses of complex literary and critical themes in both spoken and written formats
syllabus:
**Weeks 1 and 2** Homer and Afterwards: _The Iliad_; Christopher Logue, _War Music_; Alice Oswald, _Memorial: A Version of Homer’s Iliad_

**Week 3** Civil War: Thucydides, _History of the Peloponnesian War_; (war) trauma: some modern theoretical co-ordinates

**Weeks 4 and 5** “And smote him thus”: Shakespearean war traumas _(Henry IV Part One and Part Two_, _Henry V_, _Othello_, _Troilus and Cressida_)

**Week 6 and 7** Civil War #2: Milton, Marvell, and female voices of the English Civil War/English Revolution

**Week 8** Romantic Intimacy and Distance: figures of war in Wordsworth, Charlotte Smith, Coleridge, and Byron

**Week 9** Tolstoy’s Sebastopol

**Weeks 10, 11 and 12** Anticipations and legacies of the Great War: Modernists and Expressionists (Hulme, Eliot, Benn, Trakl, and Heym); the re-lived (Wilfred Owen, Ivor Gurney, and Robert Graves); prose witnesses and participants (Rebecca West, Ernst Jünger, and Blaise Cendrars, _Lice_)

**Weeks 13, 14, and 15** _Againness_ (WWII): Keith Douglas; the letters, diaries and fiction of Elizabeth Bowen; Lynette Roberts; Victor Klemperer; Adam Foulds, _In the Wolf’s Mouth_; Jewish and non-European traumas

**Week 16** Vietnam and Other (Post-)Colonial Adventures: R.L. Barth, Yosef Komunyakaa, and Andrea Brady

**Week 17** Civil War 3#: Seamus Heaney’s Troubles

**Week 18** Consolidation
prerequisite: ◎Unavailable for M.A. program students (M.A. program courses excepted) and B.A. program students.
